concepts.title: Perimeter of Polygons
concepts.content: The perimeter of a closed figure is the sum of all its sides. Perimeter of square = 4a. Perimeter of rectangle = 2(l+b). Given the perimeter and one side, we can find the other side using algebra.

examples.text: Rectangle 17cm Ã— 15cm: P = 2(17+15) = 64 cm
Square side tripled: new P = 3 Ã— original P
Playground with multiple sides: add all side lengths

keyPoints: Perimeter = sum of all sides
Perimeter of square = 4a
Perimeter of rectangle = 2(l+b)

concepts.title: Surface Area of a Cuboid
concepts.content: A cuboid has 6 rectangular faces. Opposite faces are equal. Total surface area of cuboid = 2(lb + bh + lh) where l = length, b = breadth, h = height. This gives the total area of all 6 faces.

examples.text: Matchbox 4Ã—2.5Ã—1.5cm: paper needed = 2(4Ã—2.5+2.5Ã—1.5+4Ã—1.5) = 47 cmÂ²
Open box: find surface area with 5 faces (no top)
3 pairs of opposite faces: lb, bh, lh â€” each counted twice

keyPoints: Cuboid has 6 rectangular faces
Opposite faces are equal (3 pairs)
Total SA = 2(lb + bh + lh)
For open box: subtract area of one face (the open top)
Sheet metal needed = total surface area
